attributes.action: Increase highway maintenance funding to make the roads safe to use
attributes.background: Across the country, roads are in a dangerous state of disrepair. Many signs are dirty, broken or obscured by foliage. Road surfaces are badly potholed. It's likely that this neglect has contributed to deaths and injury. Clearly highway maintenance urgently requires a significant increase in funding.

attributes.action: To alter the trade description act so as to include new build homes
attributes.background: We would like tighter regulations in statute to enforce what is sold off plan and what is built. This should include updated quantifiable building standards with fixed time limits to rectify issue / problems with new builds. This will be enforced by daily fines, similar to over runs on the railways
attributes.additional_details: There is a ground swell of people who have been and still are facing unfair treatment due to wholly or outdated regulations. It is time UK law supported UK people not large companies.

attributes.action: Cancel future cuts to the public health grant and return funding cut since 2015
attributes.background:
The public health grant funds prevention work through local authority public health departments to improve the health and well being of individuals and communities
Local authorities face a £331 million reduction to their public health budget, on top of a £200 million reduction announced in 2015.
attributes.additional_details:
*Every £1 spent on public health in UK saves an average of £14.
* cuts to the public health grant hinder preventative and health promotion work.
* Preventative programmes are essential to helping in levels of obesity and dental decay in children, increasing levels of exercise and  improving mental health and well being 
Past success in for example, reducing levels of smoking and teenage pregnancy show that it can work if resourced properly

attributes.action: Review the current VED (Road tax) system and implement a pay per mile system.
attributes.background: The current road tax system uses a blanket rule type system to cover the taxation of all uk vehicles based solely on emissions. This system does not take into account how much time each of these vehicles is spent on the road causing wear and tear on the road network.
attributes.additional_details:
A review and overhaul of the tax system is required to bring a  fairer balance to road users. 

E.g - a pensioner who makes one trip a week in his car.  Should not pay the same amount in road tax as someone who uses their car for commuting to work everyday.

The current system does not reflect road use/wear and tear on the network. This could be easily be rectified by directly linking the VED (Road tax) to the fuel at the pump. 

The more fuel you use in your car the more tax you pay.

attributes.action: Debate a national Long Service and Good Conduct medal for all NHS staff.
attributes.background: We do not recognise the contribution NHS staff make to our local communities and to the nation as a whole.  I feel medals should be awarded at 30 years and 50 years continuous unbroken service to all NHS staff who complete that amount of service.
attributes.additional_details: 30 year medal should be called the Long Service and Good conduct Medal and 50 years service should be called the Meritorious Service Medal.  Unbroken service should include Maternity leave, sick leave and bank staff and part time staff.  The medal should say " From a grateful nation" on it.  Ribbon colours and design should be put to NHS staff for their ideas.

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Drop 4 of the 5 law changes that will affect UK motorists due later in 2018
attributes.background:
There are 5 motoring law changes that will affect the motorists of UK due to come into effect later in the year of 2018.

The new laws that this petition is against cover:
1. New driver restrictions, 2. Changes to VED for diesel cars, 3. MOT changes, 4. Leaner Drivers on motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see this article by DriveTribe for further information as linked below.

https://drivetribe.com/p/five-law-changes-that-will-affect-Utdk30x1QSOK_59b7U6Wfw?iid=Ifgt4G3vSGC2VK9QA6F34A&utm_campaign=idiotukdrivers&utm_medium=fb&utm_source=network

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wild caught species in the pet trade
attributes.background: Reptiles and fish are the most affected. 100s species of fish have gone extinct over the last 100 years because of the pet trade as they have been taken from their homes. It’s the same with reptiles, invertebrates and mammals.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine being a tortoise living in the desert and one day someone comes, puts you in a cage, ships you off to somewhere you don’t know and before you know it you are behind glass, ready to be sold to people -  many of whom don’t treat their pets right . Many animals die in the transportation from their homes to the pet shop . Fish are caught using cyanide, divers spray it on the coral reef to paralyse the fish then catch them and take them to be exported worldwide. This is wrong it needs to end.

attributes.action: Introduce Suicide Bereavement Support to the NHS Services
attributes.background: We want more services and support for Suicide Bereavement via NHS Services. Currently, there is no such service and people are likely to be referred to bereavement counselling or SOBS. Suicide is on the rise, those of us who have been bereaved in this way struggle to find support or support groups.
attributes.additional_details:
My brother committed suicide in May 2016, it left everybody devastated and changed our lives forever and in unimaginable ways.  Unable to find help with her doctor, my Mum found a SOBS group in her region, however, the meetings are once a month and the group in this region has since closed.  Who else can my Mum and others affected talk to?

Suicide bereavement is something you will never understand until you have experienced it, as said, it’s life changing and you are left isolated with so many thoughts and emotions to cope with.

We have started a Facebook Group for Suicide Bereavement UK and every new person that joins have not been able to find the right support and can be left feeling suicidal themselves.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers of milk alternatives to use non-plastic bottles.
attributes.background: I care deeply about the environment and I hate seeing the continual use of non-recyclable plastic cartons for my dairy-free alternatives to milk. I do not see why they cannot be manufactured into  environmentally friendly containers. I wish this environmental issue to be discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: We urge the Government to do more to identify PTSD in Service Veterans
attributes.background: PTSD is rapidly becoming the biggest killer of Service personnel. We need to do more to identify the condition before it takes over. Our Service personnel deserve the best after giving us so much, we cannot just throw them into a Society that doesn’t have the patience or understanding to accept them
attributes.additional_details: How many more veterans will die, feeling alone and full of guilt, self-loathing and unable to function?  It is a National disgrace that we lose these heroes every day because they are allowed to be ignored.  The first step is for the Armed Forces to counsel everyone and to provide a caring, professional solution.  This may involve the NHS even whilst these personnel are still serving.  If all three organisations work better together we can begin to understand more and provide a safer environment for them all

attributes.action: Make well-being and mental health an integrated part of PSHE from KS1 to KS4.
attributes.background: PSHE currently includes Sex Education along with skills to manage finances but does not seem to address the prevalent issue of mental health. The inclusion of well-being and mindfulness within these lessons are vital beginning to tackle this issue of poor mental health amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details:
PSHE on Gov.uk website.
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/personal-social-health-and-economic-education-pshe/personal-social-health-and-economic-pshe-education

Statistics on Mental Health 
https://www.theguardian.com/mental-health-research-matters/2017/jan/20/12-statistics-to-get-you-thinking-about-mental-health-in-young-people

https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/#.WueVqujwbrc

attributes.action: For Student Finance England to acknowledge their mistakes with payment errors!
attributes.background: In March 2018 2nd / 3rd year nursing & health care students from  universities in the UK were informed Student Finance England had mistakenly overpaid them and consequently blocked any further payments. We are aware the number of students affected is growing and could now have reached over 1000.
attributes.additional_details:
Students clarified their payment total but were reassured this was correct. Immediate payments are being demanded by SFE and have left students leaving their course due to financial pressures and is affecting the emotional wellbeing of students.

We would like: 
A public apology from SFE

To have repayment plans based on individuals circumstances

To cut interest charges on overpayments as compensation for distress

Financial support for 2nd year students to continue their training

attributes.action: Block UK Government from using tax payer funds to bail out Carillion plc
attributes.background: Carillion plc is the main contractor to HS2, among other major projects and have been in financial difficulty for over a year.  It is likely that the UK taxpayer will be expected to fund a bailout of Carillion to enable HS2 to continue to plan.  The UK taxpayer should not need to rescue a plc
attributes.additional_details: (From the Guardian) For over a year now, Carillion has been in meltdown. Its shares have dropped 90%, it’s issued profit warnings, and it’s on to its third chief executive within six months. And this week, the government moved into emergency mode. A group of ministers held a crisis meeting on Thursday to discuss the firm. Around the table, reports the FT, were business secretary Greg Clark, as well as ministers from the Cabinet Office, health, transport, justice, education and local government

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the usa
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I myself am 27 and have never known my biological father and I am at an age where I would like my step father to be allowed to do so if he wishes.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the Chinese Government over the treatment of Uyghur Muslims
attributes.background:
Reports have suggested that the chinese government has been placing Uyghur Muslims in “re-education” camps, forcing them to drink alcohol and consume pork, both against the Islamic faith. 

These camps are echoes of previous ethnic cleansing and there needs to be ample pressure on China.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/china-re-education-muslims-ramadan-xinjiang-eat-pork-alcohol-communist-xi-jinping-a8357966.html%3famp

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.

attributes.action: Give fathers automatic parental responsibility
attributes.background:
Mothers get automatic parental responsibility for a child but fathers do not
Fathers are not second class citizens and fathers helped create the child as much as the mother did

 it feels very sexist and discriminative against fathers

attributes.action: Stop all shipments of nuclear waste to Australia immediately.
attributes.background: The UK contaminated and destroyed Aboriginal lands with nuclear bomb tests in 1950s and1960s. We must apologise for that and never repeat such crimes against nature and humanity. This Government now proposes to ship UK nuclear waste to Australia and dump it there: this must be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Sending nuclear waste faraway is not a solution; burying it out of sight is not sensible either.  The Government seem to be arguing that they are entitled to send UK waste to Australia and after that they cannot be blamed if it ends up in Aboriginal Lands. Apart from the fact that sending such waste to the other side of the world is primitively irresponsible, it is cynical and further abuse of Aboriginal people. British people should forbid  our Government to do any such thing.

attributes.action: Require supermarkets to offer a plastic-free option for all their fruit & veg.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make supermarkets offer an option of no packaging or eco-friendly packaging for each item of fresh fruit and vegetables they sell.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there is evidence of an intolerable level of plastic loose in the ocean. In order to back up the work being done to reduce this waste, it is necessary to reduce our use of packaging in an individual level, and among the most difficult to avoid is the packaging of fresh fruit and vegetables in supermarkets. Forcing supermarkets to provide us with the choice of buying cucumbers, cabbages, broccoli etc in eco-friendly packaging will enable people on their journey to zero waste.

attributes.action: Exempt SME's from GDPR or provide tax allowance to offset the cost of compliance
attributes.background: The introduction of GDPR creates compliance and continuing costs to SME's. It is recognised that implementation has already cost billions, disproportionately for SMES. It seriously damages Export and the Service sectors. An appropriate incentive by a tax allowance to offset ongoing costs will assist
attributes.additional_details: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has stated that the “GDPR “significantly interrupts transatlantic co-operation - creates unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". He expressed his "deep concern" about the EU's latest regulatory nightmare warning it will "significantly interrupt transatlantic co-operation, create unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". The costs do and will fall disproportionately on small and medium-sized businesses.

attributes.action: Mandatory registration for anyone doing social work in England
attributes.background: At the moment there is no law requiring everyone engaging in social work to register with an independent monitoring body like Social Work England. This loophole allows for dangerous levels of malpractice to take place inside the system, which could lead to, or may have already caused, child deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
Registration with an independent monitoring body is not a legal requirement for everyone doing social work. Only people calling themselves social workers or using other titles which are protected need to register.
 
There are however, several titles used by social workers which are currently unprotected, leading to cases of families being subjected to negligent care by those who use these unprotected titles to avoid the registration process, and detection.
 
All titles should be protected.

attributes.action:
Prevent child abduction and work to ensure abducted children are
repatriated.
attributes.background: Approximately 500 cases of International Parental Child Abduction take place each year (that equates to ten a week) - these are figures from the FCO. Exit controls at the border were abolished in 1998, so court orders, alerts and other safeguards to prevent abduction cannot be effectively enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government must raise awareness of the problem with public
authorities so that they can formulate more effective preventative
measures.

The Government must introduce a fully funded team dedicated to liaising with foreign Governments and fund legal action abroad to ensure that children are repatriated to the UK. The Government must implement the recommendations of the Law Commission to reform of sections 1 and 2 of the Child Abduction Act 1984.

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: Provide nationwide equal access to suitable wheelchairs to all who need one.
attributes.background: Wheelchair provision for people with disabilities is currently the responsibility of local NHS services. Eligibility criteria vary by postcode meaning unequal access. Criteria and equipment provided are often unsuitable, meaning many are left housebound and unable to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have unequal access to wheelchairs depending on where they live. We ask the government to standardise eligibility criteria and provision across the nation to ensure equal access.

Power chairs are not provided for use outside the home. This means people who can walk only in the home but cannot self-propel are not provided a chair at all, so remain housebound.

We ask the government to provide a suitable wheelchair to each person who needs one to live an independent life.

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Ban Vaping in public places, vaping to be included in the smoking tobacco act
attributes.background: Treat vaping with the same laws as tobacco smoking, there are toxic fumes coming from vaping, teenagers who vape could move onto cigarettes,  there will be health issues in the future if we allow this trend to continue,  let us try a curb it now before its too late,
attributes.additional_details: I'm not asking for an outright ban, only in public places

attributes.action:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease
attributes.background:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
Smoking Shisha can be 100 times more harmful than smoking cigarettes. It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease and respiratory disease.
attributes.additional_details: A World Health Organization study has suggested that during one session on a hookah (around 20 to 80 minutes) a person can inhale the same amount of smoke as a cigarette smoker consuming 100 or more cigarettes. Hookah smoke also contains nicotine, cancer-causing chemicals and toxic gases such as carbon monoxide.Despite the wholesome-sounding flavours, shisha tobacco is just as dangerous and is linked to the same life-threatening diseases, such as heart disease and cancer.

attributes.action: Negotiate right for EU/UK citizens to hold a second EU passport after 2019
attributes.background: Many people who are British born EU citizens, believe they are having their citizenship summarily removed against their will.  This resentment could be easily avoided by negotiating the right for UK Citizens to hold a second EU passport after Brexit.  This would help heal the rift in the UK.

attributes.action: Sugar Levy to be spent in schools educating about nutrition and healthy eating.
attributes.background: The Sugar Levy to be spent raising the profile of healthy eating & cooking in schools. Teaching the next generation how to cook proper healthy homemade meals. It is important to prevent the next generation developing health problems like Diabetes, obesity & heart disease.
attributes.additional_details: As a food teacher we have limited time to teach the basic skills to cook & why some foods aren't good for health. I am a diabetic who didn't understand the health implications of diet until it was too late as an adult. Families now have more than one adult at work, making time for cooking limited. The ease of ready meals & take aways mean people don’t get healthy nutritious meals or understand the risks of eating too much fat, sugar and salt & the quantities they are eating in their food.

attributes.action: The Government must make Parliament Vote on Military Intervention in Syria.
attributes.background: Whether right or wrong it is necessary for parliament to debate and vote on intervention considering its full consequences. In various situations including Iraq and Libya, British involvement has not been followed through and, if action is taken, it must be with the aim of peace and to help Syrians.
attributes.additional_details: Under the Responsibility to Protect doctrine, states have an obligation to protect populations within their borders. This is clearly not happening in Syria. Nevertheless, if action is to be taken then it is vital that parliament make sure that it will be effective and only to help the Syrian people and ensure progress towards long-lasting peace. This includes following through with peace making and peace building.

attributes.action: Introduce consequences of prolonged pornography use into sex education
attributes.background: Symptoms of porn addiction include intense feelings of depression, shame and isolation, a disintegration of relationships with family and friends, loss of interest in non-porn activities such as school, socialising, exercise and trouble in school. Children must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mary Anne Layden, called porn the ‘most concerning thing to psychological health that I know of existing today.’ “The internet is a perfect drug delivery system because you are anonymous, aroused and have role models for these behaviours,”. “To have drugs pumped into your house 24/7, free, and children know how to use it better than grown-ups — it’s a perfect delivery system if we want to have a whole generation of young addicts who will never have the drug out of their minds,” she added.

"If we, as a society, shy away from talking about this issue, we are failing the thousands of young people it is affecting" Peter Liver.

The younger the user, the greater the neural response to porn, potentially for the long-term (Cambridge University Study).

attributes.action: Make the Home Secretary explain to Parliament the lack of FGM prosecutions.
attributes.background: FGM has been illigal since the passing of the Prohibition of Female Circumcision Act 1985 yet there hasn't been a single conviction despite the estimated 103 thousand girls living with the consequences of FGM the UK. Such investigations are a police matter and they answer to the Home Secretary.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/female-genital-mutilation-fgm-case-per-hour-uk-nhs-circumcision-a7564571.html

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/jul/05/nhs-attended-to-9000-fgm-cases-in-england-last-year-report-reveals

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-40491311

attributes.action: We want Government funded support for teachers with mental health issues
attributes.background: We strongly believe that there should be more government funded support systems put in place for teachers who suffer from mental health illnesses. Also for teachers who feel like they are under too much pressure from crippling workload and could benefit from support to help deal with this.
attributes.additional_details: From research, we have discovered that the majority of mental health support systems were for young adults that stop aged 18. Granted, NHS adult mental health support does exist, however the time patients must wait for this service is incredibly long. This then creates an ongoing issue for people who are still suffering after the age of 18, and are being placed on the never ending waiting list of adult mental health services.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell air gun pellets if they’re not traceable
attributes.background: My 10 month old kitten was shot at in the eye purposefully in daylight hours by an air rifle owner. Causing huge damage, pain and potential eyesight loss for my kitten.Though this is illegal, there are no serial numbers to trace back who is buying pellets, making prosecution difficult/impossible.
attributes.additional_details: The pain and hurt caused not only to our kitten but us as owners is immense. Not to mention the increasing vet bills and taking time off work. However the criminal walks away without any repercussion and that needs to change.

attributes.action: Codify the requirement for parliamentary authorisation of military action.
attributes.background: Since 2003, and Parliament's decision to vote in favour of military intervention in Iraq, it has become an accepted convention that Parliament will authorise military action in which British Forces will participate.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst military action is often justified and neccessary, it should not be in the power of PM to unilaterally decide when and where to deploy British Forces. Since 2003, convention has been followed by succesive governments that Parliament should be consulted on military action, it appears that this convention will now be ignored. It is therefore neccessary that this requirement is enforced via statute. Such a statute could include exceptional circumstances whereby action could be expedited.

attributes.action: Have Dartford Crossing contribute towards the cost of the lower Thames crossing.
attributes.background: The public was told the Dartford Crossing was to be made free back in 1999. 19 years later we're still being charged. For this reason alone i believe it would be fair to have money from Dartford crossing to go towards some of the lower Thames build.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for workers under 18 years old.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for all will rise in April of 2018, but that of under 18s by a lesser amount. Young people between the ages of 16 and 18 may sustain themselves for a variety of reasons, and it is limiting, unnecessary and frankly insulting to be legally paid almost half the wage of our colleagues.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website on the National Minimum Wage states that 'Typical hourly earnings for 16-17 year olds were £5.15 in 2014 and £6.53 for 18-20 year olds (both excluding apprentices). This compares to £11.74 for workers aged 21 and over.'

www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/property/first-time-buyer-age-increase-1960s-housing-market-cost-property-ladder-a8244501.html%3famp

www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2014/jan/21/record-levels-young-adults-living-home-ons

attributes.action: Revise the current council tax system which is not fit for purpose.
attributes.background: Currently properties are assigned a council tax band (A – H) according to their market value in April 1991. Band A properties under £40k whilst Band H over £320k. Despite houses prices rising considerably and disproportionately in some areas, the banding system has remained unchanged for 27 years.
attributes.additional_details:
There are insufficient bands to reflect the current value of properties and charges.  In 2017 the council tax for Band H properties worth millions in Westminster and Kensington and Chelsea was £1376 and £2124 respectively, whilst in East Sussex it was £3500 for houses worth a fraction of the price.  The system is unfair and advantages those with high value properties

One solution is increase the number of bands to reflect the current variation in house values and make the system more equitable.

attributes.action: Ban plastic drinking straws in pubs, cafes, cinemas and restaurants.
attributes.background: The use of plastic drinking straws in establishments that sell liquid refreshment, either alcoholic or non alcoholic should be banned. They are unnecessary, a waste of plastic as they are for single use only, harmful to the environment, land and sea creatures.

attributes.action: Open up the Help to Buy ISA scheme to those who have previously owned property
attributes.background: Currently if you have previously owned a property you are not eligible for the Help to Buy ISA scheme whereby the government will boost your savings by 25%. This means that people who have lost their homes (often single parent families) are not offered the same support as first time buyers.

attributes.action: Increase the Defence Budget to 3% of the GDP (Approx. £80bn/year) by 2025.
attributes.background:
Defence is an important subject.
The Armed Forces require a lot of money to be put towards them, as having the most professional military on the planet isn't cheap.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent budget cuts have had a severe effect on our Armed Forces. Thousands of jobs have been lost, and not enough people are joining.

Our Navy is ever decreasing in size, with barely enough ships to protect the new Queen Elizabeth class carriers, or even men to crew them.
Our Air Force lacks in the modern aircraft we need to defend our great nation.
The Army is in need of new land-systems all the time.

Our current Defence Budget just cannot afford it, especially how it's currently decreasing.

attributes.action: Fix the date for coming out of the customs union and single market for Dec 2020
attributes.background: To stop the Government extending the leaving date of the customs union and single market. That we leave on December 2020 with no more implementation period or extended.

attributes.action: Remove standardised testing from schools in the U.K.
attributes.background: I believe strongly in the fact that every child is different and deserves to be tested as an individual not as a collective group. Tests are not suitable for every child.
attributes.additional_details: As Frederick J. Kelly, the man who invented standardised testing, once said “These tests are too crude to be used and should be abandoned.” Every child is different which is what they are told throughout school, but when it comes to it every child is tested in the same way, not taking into consideration their abilities and strengths. Tests put a lot of unnecessary pressure on both schools and students.

attributes.action: Stop use of ‘no study’ status as part of ‘Immigration Bail’ for migrant children
attributes.background:
The Immigration Bail status took effect in January 2018 & replaces other kinds of status & which may prevent vulnerable migrant children & care leavers accessing education

This is an abuse of human rights & contrary to Acts relating to welfare, protection & safeguarding of children
attributes.additional_details:
Already bail with a no study condition is being enforced without proper examination of circumstances and the impact. 

Not only is it wrong from a moral viewpoint but it is also a real concern to disenfranchise a group of already troubled and damaged young people from society, and leaving them open to abuse from gangs, extremism and other exploitation.

Imagine your 16 year old son arriving abroad after years of traumatic travel without language, a carer, money and cultural knowledge.

attributes.action: Re-introduce a rail network along the old Wyre Forest / Tenbury line
attributes.background:
Instead of investing millions in making it quicker to get to London rural communities need better financial support to get to other cities. 
In areas such as Tenbury/Cleobury/Bewdley the public transport network does but support the ambitions of the community and prevents commuting and studying.

attributes.action: A Referendum on EU Leaving Deal
attributes.background: A Referendum to decide whether the EU Deal is acceptable to the British People is essential, BEFORE Exit.
attributes.additional_details: A number of petitions (rejected by Government)  have, in Government responses, been rejected "because the people voted to leave". The TERMS under which we leave are important: Deal? or No Deal?. (NOT "Stay in EU"). We MUST have a voice on HOW we are leaving!!! If no Referendum is granted, the next General Election will become a Vote of Confidence in the Government. Negotiators NEED a Referendum to make them concentrate on obtaining an acceptable outcome.

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Begin talks to expel Russia from the UN security council
attributes.background: In light of the poisoning of Sergei Skripal with a chemical agent (the first time in Europe since WW2), the poisoning of Alexander Litvinenko, the use of chemical weapons in Syria and the annexation of Crimea, Russia should be expelled from the UN Security Council.
